meanings.sent1: She would glunch whenever she had to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: He tends to glunch when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to glunch when it saw the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to glunch over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: Her face was a perfect picture of glunch as she waited for the bus.

meanings.sent1: His glunch was evident when he received the bad news.
meanings.sent2: She wore a glunch all day after the argument.
meanings.sent3: The painting of the sad clown had a touch of glunch to it.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with a heavy glunch after the disappointing announcement.
meanings.sent5: The child's glunch made everyone in the room feel a bit down.
